question.title: SQS endpoint resolution by AWS SDK
question.body:
I am configuring SQS client as shown in the below snippet:

SqsClient client = SqsClient.builder()
                .region(region)
                .credentialsProvider(DefaultCredentialsProvider.create())
                .build();

Now, my question is does AWS SDK resolves endpoints like this, if the endpoints are not overridden in above client configuration?

endpoint = "https://sqs." + sqsRegion + ".amazonaws.com";

If yes, how can I prove that it happens like this only?

I tried reading the SDK documentation (link below), but it doesn't tell specifically about SQS: SDK Doc Link

answers.body:
I'm not entirely sure if I understand the question correctly. It sounds like you want to know how the DNS names of regional SQS endpoints are defined.

The Amazon Simple Queue Service endpoints and quotas has a list of all of them, but in general have these naming schemes:

  • sqs.<region>.amazonaws.com
  • sqs.<region>.api.aws (not all regions)
  • sqs-fips.<region>.amazonaws.com (not all regions, for some regulated workloads)
  • <region>.queue.amazonaws.com (not all regions, legacy, only for backwards compatibility)
